comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: news.google.com/newspapers?id=utBaAAAAIBAJ&sjid=JJIDA... Here's a 1922 Sydney Mail article titled 'The Novel Sport of Turtle Riding' (!) ...doesn't look like the same crowd though...my guess is the ANMM pic might have been taken somewhat later...in the 1930s...and not necessarily in the same location...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Thanks for this article! We have previously discussed here starting a file on 'Politically Incorrect Moments from History', and I think turtle-riding would be top of the list. It doesn't sound any more pleasant (for the turtle) in the article, especially the part where they collected all the eggs up?! I'm looking to do a blog on this in the next couple of weeks, so will post it here :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Ah so awkward! That's article really demonstrates the mix of tourism and scientific expeditions that allowed turtle riding to become popular. Fascinating!
